text: Says Donald Trump has outlined 'policies that read like a Kremlin wish list.'
author: Michael Morell

text: 'Libya supplies the oil for China. We get no oil from Libya.'
author: Donald Trump

text: 'A gallon (of gasoline) delivered to the front lines for our troops in Afghanistan cost more than $400.'
author: Marcy Kaptur

text: The United States can immediately tap a domestic energy resource of 'more than 1.5 trillion barrels of oil, six times more than Saudi Arabia.'
author: Eric Hovde

text: About 750,000 people die in China each year from auto emissions.
author: Nancy Pelosi

text: 'Long gas lines forming in North Korea.'
author: Donald Trump

text: Says President Barack Obama delivered $2 billion to Brazil to help with offshore drilling projects.
author: Rick Perry

text: Says Barack Obama told the U.S. Coast Guard Academy 'that the number one threat to the military and the world today is global warming.'
author: Scott Walker

text: Climate change is 'directly related' to the growth of terrorism.
author: Bernie Sanders

text: The decision for the United States to buy heavy water from Iran 'will directly subsidize Iran’s nuclear program.'
author: Paul Ryan

text: Every time the price of gasoline rises 1 cent, 'it's a billion dollars out of our economy that goes to Saudi Arabia.'
author: Tommy Thompson

text: Proposed tax changes are a 'handout' to BP.
author: National Taxpayers Union

text: Says Ronald Reagan 'got the Saudis to flood the market with cheap oil.'
author: Michael Reagan

text: 'Obama spent $7 billion to bring electricity to Africa, failed miserably.'
author: Daniel Greenfield

text: Says that in a hearing, Rep. Gabrielle Giffords suggested to Gen. David Petraeus that the Army 'put more emphasis on less environmentally damaging methods, like stabbing or clubbing enemy forces in order to minimize the carbon output.'
author: Chain email

text: 'Iraq has the second-largest oilfields in the world (behind) Saudi Arabia.'
author: Donald Trump

text: Says 'Donald Trump says climate change is a hoax invented by the Chinese.'
author: Hillary Clinton

text: The Arab Spring … 'drove up gas prices.'
author: Barack Obama

text: Says ExxonMobil 'fought to kill' a rule requiring oil and mining companies to disclose payments made to foreign governments.
author: Sherrod Brown

text: 'ISIS is making millions of dollars a week selling Libyan oil.'
author: Donald Trump

text: 'Barbara Boxer's worried about the weather' instead of terrorism as the biggest threat to national security.
author: Carly Fiorina

text: Says Hillary Clinton 'gave up 20 percent of America's uranium supply to Russia.'
author: Donald Trump

text: Russian natural gas company 'Gazprom held Europe by the throat -- they were a monopoly, and now the U.S. is breaking into that monopoly with our exports of (liquefied natural gas).'
author: Pat Robertson

text: 'I have never lobbied against sanctions personally... to my knowledge, Exxon never directly lobbied against sanctions.
author: Rex Tillerson

text: The Republican-controlled Wisconsin Senate approved a bill 'denying veterans the right to recover their medical costs for cancers they developed while serving their country.'
author: Chris Larson

text: 'USAID put $8 billion up and attracted more than $45 billion in a public-private partnership called Power Africa.'
author: David Perdue

text: 'Our federal government has lent $2 billion to the state-owned oil company of Brazil to allow them to explore for oil and gas.'
author: George Allen

text: The climate-change agreement between the United States and China 'requires the Chinese to do nothing at all for 16 years.'
author: Mitch McConnell

text: Just before Thanksgiving, oil was $54 a barrel, down from $82. 'Thank you to Saudi Arabia.'
author: Donald Trump

text: Says President Barack Obama’s homeland security budget had '$16 million to fight climate change' but 'didn't have a line item to fight violent extremism.'
author: Sean Duffy

text: If President Obama signs the Copenhagen climate change treaty, he 'will sign your freedom, your democracy, and your prosperity away forever — and neither you nor any subsequent government you may elect would have any power whatsoever to take it back again.'
author: Christopher Monckton

text: 'Bill Clinton gave North Korea $5 billion and two nuclear reactors in 1994, essentially giving them nukes.'
author: Viral image

text: 'Mike Morell testified and told Congress that the reason Obama has not bombed ISIS' oil fields is they're concerned about global warming.'
author: Ted Cruz

text: Says Hillary Clinton 'negotiated the first agreement — ever — where China and India officially committed to reduce their emissions.'
author: Bill Clinton

text: 'Fifteen out of the 20 most polluted cities in the world' are in India and China.
author: Jim Webb

text: The U.S. spends $4 billion on research and development for energy, while spending $350 billion on oil from foreign countries, 'many of whom are our enemies.'
author: Jeff Greene

text: 'San Juan Teamsters didn't show up for work to distribute relief supplies' because they went on strike.
author: Bloggers

text: A video accurately compares weather reports from Sweden and Iraq.
author: Dan Evon

text: 'It's important to pay attention to the Russian spy drama, but let's not ignore the fact that the following (10) bills have been introduced' in the House.
author: Social Media

text: The Paris Agreement 'is by far the largest number of countries ever to sign an international agreement on a single day.'
author: Ban Ki-moon

text: Says 'the cascading effects' of climate change contributed to the rise of ISIS.
author: Martin O'Malley

text: More money is dedicated within the Department of Homeland Security to climate change than what's spent combating 'Islamist terrorists radicalizing over the Internet in the United States of America.'
author: Michael McCaul

text: 'Over the past eight years, the United States has reduced our total carbon pollution more than any other nation on Earth.'
author: Barack Obama

text: Despite the U.S. spending $10 billion on Iraq's electrical system, Baghdad still only gets five hours of electricity a day.
author: George Packer

text: 'The truth is any oil that would be drilled could be sent to any other country in the world, reducing our use of foreign oil not by one single drop.'
author: Bill Nelson
